Description: Largely intact, mended, pottery vessel with a small spout for pouring and a vertical loop handle at ninety degrees to it; circular opening on top. Black-glazed apart from the area surrounding the opening which is decorated with black spirals.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 131, no. 365, pl. XXXIX)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 236)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2171)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5713 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
